definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: In this paper, the effect of Osteopontin (OPN) gene on the Black Dahe pig reproductive performance was researched.

sentences.english: The Yangtse River, the longest river in china, is the golden waterway for river transportation.

sentences.english: The building faces the big rimmer.
We have got past the big rivers and just turned into a little one.

sentences.english: The yellow river is the world's fifth largest river with a 5464 kilometres long river.

sentences.english: The brisk brave brigade broke the brick bridge across the broad bloody river.

sentences.english: At last they turned off the big river into a little side river that came down to join it.

sentences.english: Countless small streams converge to form a large river.

sentences.english: At the same time, studies on estuaries are mainly restricted on those large rivers.
sentences.chinese: 同时，对河口湾的研究更多是集中于大江大河。

sentences.english: The Irish tap dance has transformed folk dance into commercial performance successfully.
